item.description:
FRI OCT 14 –An Enemy Of The People with Connecticut Theatre Group *ADV TIX DISCOUNT*

The strongest one is the one who stands alone.
When Dr. Stockmann makes a poisonous discovery, his brother, the Mayor, begins a war of innuendo and half-truths that threatens to tear their family-and their community-apart. Arthur Miller wrote his adaptation of Henrik Ibsen's classic play, An Enemy of the People, in response to the political climate fostered by McCarthyism in 1950. Miller asks timeless questions such as: Should the majority always rule? Who is responsible when the majority is wrong? Should a righteous man stand up for truth at any cost or should he compromise for the benefit of his family and his personal well-being? Miller's powerful adaptation is still very relevant today.
"It flames out of a fiery spirit. Mr. Miller's adaptation is compact, idiomatic, and eminently actable, and it also preserves Ibsen's moral point of view." -NY Times.
Directed by Kyle Fabel

 

THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT - GET YOUR TICKET NOW

 

Pre-Party starts at 6:30pm - Show starts at 8pm FREE SAFE PARKING

 

**RECEIVE A 20% DISCOUNT ON FOOD AND DRINK AT THE PRE-PARTY WITH YOUR TICKET**

 

Advance Tickets are $25 * Tickets are $30 at the event


Playhouse on Park
244 Park Road
West Hartford, CT 06119

EXIT 43 PARK ROAD off 84

Next to AC Petersons

Pick up your ticket before the show at the pre-Party with the Connecticut Theatre Group, or at the will call window

 

WE HAVE A VERY LIMITED NUMBER OF TICKETS IN THE CONNECTICUT THEATRE GROUP SECTION

THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT - GET YOUR TICKET NOW

 

Visit www.CTTheatre.org or call (860) 987-7888
